Rule: If the education level is higher than HS-grad (e.g., Prof-school, Bachelors, Masters, or Doctorate), then the likelihood of earning more than $50,000 a year increases.
If the individual works more than 40 hours per week, then the likelihood of earning more than $50,000 a year increases.
Marital status may interact with other factors, but alone, it is not a decisive predictor of income exceeding $50,000 a year.
The occupation being Blue-Collar does not preclude earning more than $50,000 a year if other factors like education and hours worked are favorable.
